intro: Decaneuropsis eberhardtii, commonly known as the Eberhardt's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of specific host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant lacks chlorophyll and relies on its host for water and nutrients, while also deriving some photosynthetic ability from its own leaves. Its presence can influence the health and diversity of its host trees and the surrounding flora.
